multiple-choice.question: What study found that people who spent time caring for others showed no increase in stress-related death?

options.label: B
options.text: A study on 30,000 adults in the United States.

options.label: C
options.text: A study on 100,000 adults in the United States.

options.label: D
options.text: A study on 50,000 adults in the United States.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main message of McGonigal's research?

options.label: A
options.text: Stress is bad for your health.

options.label: B
options.text: Stress is good for your health.

options.label: C
options.text: Changing how you think about stress can make you healthier.

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: The robo-ants will be replaced with new ones.

options.label: D
options.text: The robo-ants will continue to walk in the same direction.

options.label: A
options.text: To turn off the lasers remotely.

options.label: B
options.text: To insert two emergency vacuum nozzles into the habitat and suck the ants up.

options.label: C
options.text: To move the robo-ants to a different location.

options.label: D
options.text: To replace the robo-ants with new ones.

title: Four billion years of evolution in six minutes - Prosanta Chakrabarty

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea that the speaker wants to convey about evolution?

options.label: D
options.text: Evolution is a complex and ongoing process.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main reason why humans and monkeys are not closely related?
What is the speaker's opinion on the idea that humans are the goal of evolution?

options.label: A
options.text: They agree that humans are the goal of evolution.

options.label: B
options.text: They disagree that humans are the goal of evolution.

options.label: C
options.text: They are unsure about the goal of evolution.

options.label: D
options.text: They think that humans are not the goal of evolution.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main problem with how evolution is often represented?
What is the speaker's opinion on the idea that humans are special because they have been on Earth for a long time?

options.label: A
options.text: They agree that humans are special.

options.label: B
options.text: They disagree that humans are special.

options.label: C
options.text: They think that humans are just one small part of a vast web of life.

options.label: D
options.text: They are unsure about human uniqueness.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main reason why understanding evolution correctly is important?

options.label: A
options.text: It helps us understand human relationships with other species.

options.label: B
options.text: It helps us understand human relationships with each other.

options.label: C
options.text: It helps us understand the natural world.

options.label: D
options.text: It helps us understand the history of life on Earth.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's opinion on the idea that life on Earth is static?

options.label: A
options.text: They agree that life on Earth is static.

options.label: B
options.text: They disagree that life on Earth is static.

options.label: C
options.text: They think that life on Earth is constantly evolving and going extinct.

options.label: D
options.text: They are unsure about the nature of life on Earth.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main idea that humans should take away from understanding evolution?

options.label: A
options.text: We are the goal of evolution.

options.label: B
options.text: We are special because we have been on Earth for a long time.

options.label: C
options.text: We are just one small part of a vast web of life.

options.label: D
options.text: We are the only species that matters.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's opinion on the idea that humans have a lot to learn about their place in the world?

options.label: A
options.text: They agree that humans have a lot to learn.

options.label: B
options.text: They disagree that humans have a lot to learn.

options.label: C
options.text: They think that humans know everything they need to know.

options.label: D
options.text: They are unsure about human knowledge.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main idea that humans should think of themselves as?

options.label: C
options.text: Young leaves on a giant tree of life.
